alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 8:46PM CST until February 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Marion and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in more flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dunlap, Whitwell, Monteagle, Powells Crossroads, Cartwright, Griffith Creek, Chimneys State Park, Martin Springs, Lone Oak, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, Foster Falls State Park and Fiery Gizzard State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
